sourceMeaningMnemonic: The radical for <radical>rain</radical> and the kanji for <kanji>rain</kanji> are the same thing.
meaningInfo: Make sure you know your radicals!
readingMnemonic: What if the <kanji>rain</kanji> actually tried to <reading>aim</reading> (<ja>あめ</ja>) for you? As in, drops would move out of their normal flight path just to hit you on your head? You'd be a lot wetter, that's for sure.
readingInfo: Imagine a world where each rain drop had to choose a target to aim for. How strange would rainfall be? Also, <ja>あめ</ja> and "aim" don't really sound too much alike, but the goal is to use "aim" to get to <ja>あめ</ja>, so make sure to take note of that in your mind as you learn the reading.
